document.chunk: Britain: Lugovoi Must Be Tried in UK
By THOMAS WAGNER Associated Press Writer
LONDON (AP) - Britain said Wednesday it would not accept a trial in a third country of a former KGB agent accused of using radioactive poison to kill a Kremlin critic.

Prime Minister Gordon Brown's office earlier appeared to have opened the way to a possible compromise deal in another country or territory, but later confirmed it would only consider a trial in Britain.
